qas.question: The name Shell is connected to what company?
What was the purpose of the created of The "Shell" Transport and Trading Company?

answers.text: to sell seashells to London collectors

qas.question: What did the younger founder of The "Shell" Transport and Trading company discover while collecting seashell specimens in the Caspian Sea area?

answers.text: there was potential in exporting lamp oil from the region

qas.question: By what year did the company have a fleet of oil tankers operating in the Caspian Sea region?
The company operated a refinery on what river for several decades?
When was the refinery at Shell Haven built?
What river did Marcus collect shells from in 1907?
How long did the younger Samuel collect specimens from the Caspian Sea?

context: The name Shell is linked to <a0_0>The "Shell" Transport and Trading Company<a0_0/>. In <b8_0>1833<b8_0/>, the founder's father, Marcus Samuel, founded an import business <a1_0>to sell seashells to <b5_0>London<b5_0/> collectors<a1_0/>. When collecting seashell specimens in the Caspian Sea area in 1892, the younger Samuel realised <a2_0>there was potential in exporting lamp oil from the region<a2_0/> and commissioned the world's first purpose-built oil tanker, the Murex (Latin for a type of snail shell), to enter this market; by <a3_0><b6_0>1907<b6_0/><a3_0/> the company had a fleet. Although for <b9_0>several decades<b9_0/> the company had a refinery at Shell Haven on the <a4_0><b7_0>Thames<b7_0/><a4_0/>, there is no evidence of this having provided the name.
